topic.title: zeronet dont close
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: 0.6.2
  * Operating system: windows 7 pro
  * Web browser: chrome last version
  * Tor status: always
  * Opened port: yes
  * Special configuration:none

### Step 2: Describe the problem:

#### Steps to reproduce:

  1.just launch zeronet
  2.wait for launching and openport and connection with tor

#### Observed Results:

after that i can shut down zeronet but it will always in  ram and i use tor too for my torretn client and him to i can shut it down but it stay in my ram
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30521714/43039948-5f343bf4-8d38-11e8-87b9-100709d56a98.png)

topic.title: listen on port 80
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version:0.6.2
  * Operating system: Asustor 3.5.14
  * Web browser:opera
  * Tor status: not available
  * Opened port: no
  * Special configuration: none

### Step 2: Describe the problem:

I want to install zeronet on an nas asustor i can install it without problem but it cant listen port 80 and dont accede to the webui because there is no web browser on the nas 

- Starting ZeroNet...
[21:27:42] - OpenSSL loaded, version: 0100020EF

[GCC 4.6.3], Gevent: 1.3.5

[21:27:43] Ui.UiServer Web interface: http://127.0.0.1:43110/
[21:27:43] Ui.UiServer --------------------------------------
[21:27:44] TorManager Connecting to Tor Controller 127.0.0.1:9051
[21:27:44] TorManager Starting self-bundled Tor, due to Tor proxy port 127.0.0.1:9050 check error: No connection

None
KeyboardInterrupt
[21:30:07] ConnServer Closed port via upnp.
[21:30:07] - All server stopped

1604066612_mirrored_alex37330_github.body: Problem solved it was PC who can Purge the memory barret
